VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the heat value of the cell corresponding to Mathematics and Faculty in the heatmap?
What is the heat value of the cell corresponding to Computer Science and Staff in the heatmap?

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.28}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Chemistry on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Chemistry on the x-axis is {0.91}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Engineering on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Engineering on the x-axis is {0.78}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Computer Science on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Computer Science on the x-axis is {0.71}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Engineering and Senior or the cell corresponding to Chemistry and Staff?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemistry} and {Staff} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Physics and Faculty or the cell corresponding to Chemistry and Junior?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemistry} and {Junior} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Computer Science and Faculty or the cell corresponding to Physics and Senior?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Computer Science} and {Faculty} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Mathematics and Senior or the cell corresponding to Mathematics and Sophomore?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Mathematics} and {Senior} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.57 to 0.61?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Physics, Junior), (Literature, PhD), (Economics, Senior), (Computer Science, Staff)}.
